resume.pageDescription: Sing Chan's resume - 25+ years experience in UX, product management, and software development.
resume.title: Résumé

header.tagline: Technical Product Leader & User Experience Architect – Bridging Usability, Engineering & Business Strategy

professionalSummary.heading: Professional Summary
professionalSummary.content: Product and UX leader with 25+ years of experience spanning enterprise SaaS, collaboration platforms, and front-end architecture. Unique ability to operate across the full stack—from requirements gathering, interaction design and front-end frameworks to cloud infrastructure optimization and QA automation. Proven track record of building UX practices from the ground up, mentoring development teams, and driving cross-functional product execution. Extensive client portfolio including federal agencies, Fortune 500 companies, financial institutions, and energy and natural resources companies.

jobs.description: Recently led an Azure Cloud infrastructure cost optimization audit, identifying and implementing reductions of 40% that eliminated over $360,000 CAD in annualized hosting costs.
contributions: Drove product execution for enterprise collaboration solutions, leading cross-functional UX, QA, engineering and cloud operations teams
Managed quality assurance team to develop comprehensive QA automation framework, improving test coverage and reducing regression defects across release cycles
Partnered with cloud operations to monitor system health, maintain SLA compliance, and ensure platform reliability
Designed and delivered product knowledge onboarding program for new team members, reducing time-to-productivity by over 50% — from one month to two weeks
Conducted customer discovery interviews and stakeholder sessions to define feature priorities and validate product-market fit
Translated customer and stakeholder requirements into actionable product roadmap priorities, aligning business needs with engineering capacity
Managed product backlog and sprint planning in collaboration with engineering teams, improving delivery predictability
Owned interaction design, user experience strategy, and front-end development frameworks for all Collabware products

jobs.description: Hired as the first UX developer in the organization to bridge communication gaps between design and engineering teams.
contributions: Built the UX practice from the ground up, introduced front-end process patterns and standards, and evangelized UX development practices
Mentored new UX developers and grew the front-end team to 8 developers
Took on group management and resource allocation responsibilities
Managed and led development of interactive projects, from the database layer all the way up to the front-end, including security, testing, deployment and documentation
Developed Flash applications, client-side scripting and XHTML/CSS markup for LLDT projects
Consulted on interface design and provided programming assistance with development of CustomBlox, LLDT's ASP.Net CMS solution
Developed grASP, a modular and extensible in-house CMS used on Grey interactive projects
Developed and maintained Grey's external and internal web sites and applications
Managed resources, project schedules, and vendor and customer relationships

entries.program: Undergraduate studies in Computer Science and Economics
